body_html:
We are generally reluctant to add more dependencies to tensorflow on external libraries. In particular, many external open-source video decoding libraries (e.g. ffmpeg) tend to be quite large and bring in many dependencies. In addition, decoding a video on the fly can be computationally expensive and may detract from the training speed.

That said, one can always build a stand-alone script that imports arbitrary libraries and provides a one-time conversion for individual video frames to tf.Example's that may be processed by TensorFlow with ease.

In particular, many external open-source video decoding libraries (e.g. ffmpeg) tend to be quite large and bring in many dependencies. In addition, decoding a video on the fly can be computationally expensive and may detract from the training speed.
That said, one can always build a stand-alone script that imports arbitrary libraries and provides a one-time conversion for individual video frames to tf.Example's that may be processed by TensorFlow with ease.
body:
We are generally reluctant to add more dependencies to tensorflow on external libraries. In particular, many external open-source video decoding libraries (e.g. ffmpeg) tend to be quite large and bring in many dependencies. In addition, decoding a video on the fly can be computationally expensive and may detract from the training speed.

That said, one can always build a stand-alone script that imports arbitrary libraries and provides a one-time conversion for individual video frames to tf.Example's that may be processed by TensorFlow with ease.
